info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 16 at 7:26PM EDT until May 16 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Mecklenburg County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Northeastern Gaston County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 815 PM EDT. * At 725 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles east of Gastonia, or near Mt Holly, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Northeast Charlotte, East Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Mt Holly, Belmont, Stanley and Lowell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
